inclusion.criterion: pre-intervention assessments, including behavioral videotaping and developmental assessments
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: developmental assessments occurred at the first and last week of 9-week intervention
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: therapist who did not involve in the intervention and was blinded to the study purpose completed all the developmental tests
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: driving and socialization behaviors were videotaped by the research team for 20 minutes/per session, one session/per week before, during and after the intervention phase at the child house or a hospital
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Cohen's kappa coefficient was calculated between the two independent raters to establish good reliability before formal coding
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: intervention: parents/caregivers and occupational therapists were responsible for the hospital-based rehabilitation service
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: research team discussed with the clinical therapists who provided training program in a hospital for 120 minutes/per session, 2 sessions/per week for a total of 9-week intervention
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: regular therapy group continued the regular therapy, including physical, occupational and speech therapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: follow-up: this period focused on the 9 weeks follow-up after receiving a treatment program
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: instrument and procedure: each participant received pre-intervention assessments, including behavioral videotaping and developmental assessments
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: data reduction and analysis: all videotapes will be coded by two independent coders, who are undergraduate students
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: children with severe sensory impairments such as blindness, deafness
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: parents/caregivers are not able to make a time commitment for the training phase
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

notes: The patient has Wilson disease, which is confirmed by high liver copper concentration. The patient's laboratory study was significant for low serum caeruloplasmin and raised 24 hour urine copper excretion.
